DOC.brief_title: Code Blue Outcomes & Process Improvement Through Leadership Optimization Using Teleintensivists-Simulation
DOC.detailed_description: Only 15-30 % patient suffer in-hospital cardiac arrest ( IHCA ) survive hospital discharge . Factors associate low mortality improve function include provision high-quality , minimally-interrupted chest compression swift defibrillation eligible arrhythmia . Unfortunately , resuscitation team provide suboptimal care 25-40 % IHCA victim . A dedicated IHCA team `` copilot '' may improve resuscitation team performance provide team leader parallel analysis , situational awareness augmentation , action checking , protocol verification , error correction . Critical care physician involvement via telemedicine link could allow experienced specialist fill `` copilot '' role cost resource-efficient manner , particularly small hospital fewer available physician . The current study evaluate consultation off-site intensive care physician via telemedicine link influence local IHCA team ' quality care , team function provider experience simulate cardiac arrest event ( `` mock code '' ) .
